SEARCH
Package music

Class KeySig

java.lang.Object
music.KeySig
public class KeySig extends Object
This class represents the KeySignatures in music. It has a majSig enum and a minSig enum, representing both Major and Minor keys. It has a map of 'keyed pitches' that translate the C major pitches to the pitches of the proper key. Its internal keySig is a major, but it can return the relative minor if requested.

  • Field Details

    • keyedPitches

      public Map<String,String> keyedPitches
      Has every pitch, and its corresponding 'keyed pitch', i.e. the key of C maj will translate this map to invalid input: '<'pitch, pitch> for every pitch. However, the key of F maj will be the same except for the pitch B, i.e. invalid input: '<'B, Bf>. TODO perhaps make this so it is just the accidental instead of the note, i.e. 'null' or 's' or 'x' corresponding to each pitch.

    • sig

      private KeySig.majSig sig
      Our major key signature for this particular instance of the key

    • KeySig

      public KeySig(String signatureString)

    • KeySig

      public KeySig(Map<String,String> customKey)
      Occasionally composers will want a custom key, like a single E# or C#
      Parameters:
      customKey - the map of pitches to accidentals as they appear in the mei element pname=e accid=s -> invalid input: '<'"e", "s">

    • translateString

      private KeySig.majSig translateString(String s)
      Takes the mei string rep of the key Sig and turns it into our enum
      Parameters:
      s - the string, formatted as xs or xf where x is the number of flats or sharps
      Returns:
      the majSig representation of the amount of sharps or flats

    • majToMinSig

      public KeySig.minSig majToMinSig(KeySig.majSig sig)
      This function takes in a major keySig and returns its corresponding natural minor key.
      Parameters:
      sig - the major keySig
      Returns:
      a minor keySig
